xxl.core.cursors.sorters
Class ShuffleCursor

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.cursors.SecureDecoratorCursor
      xxl.core.cursors.sorters.ShuffleCursor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterator, Cursor
public class ShuffleCursor
extends SecureDecoratorCursor

A shuffle-cursor is a decorator-cursor, that permutes the input iteration's elements randomly. This cursor is semilazy. Do not use it with potentially infinite streams. This operator internally builds map entries consisting of an element of the input iteration (key) and a randomly distributed integer value (value) delivered by the given iteration over discrete random numbers. These map entries are sorted according to their values and the result is a shuffled output of the input iteration.

Example usage : 

     ShuffleCursor shuffler = new ShuffleCursor(
         new Enumerator(11),
         new DiscreteRandomNumber(
             new JavaDiscreteRandomWrapper(new Random())
         )
     );
 
     shuffler.open();
 
     while (shuffler.hasNext())
         System.out.println(shuffler.next());
 
     shuffler.close();
This example demonstrates the shuffle-cursor functionality. The shuffle-cursor returns the same set of elements of the input enumerator, but in a random order. The random numbers are taken from an iteration over discrete random number that has to be passed at construction time.

See Also:
Iterator, Cursor, SecureDecoratorCursor

Method Detail

next

public Object next()
            throws IllegalStateException,
                   NoSuchElementException
Returns the next element in the iteration. This element will be accessible by some of the shuffle-cursor's methods, e.g., update or remove, until a call to next or peek occurs. This is calling next or peek proceeds the iteration and therefore its previous element will not be accessible any more.

Specified by:
next in interface Iterator
Specified by:
next in interface Cursor
Overrides:
next in class SecureDecoratorCursor
Returns:
the next element in the iteration.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if the shuffle-cursor is already closed when this method is called.
NoSuchElementException - if the iteration has no more elements.

peek

public Object peek()
            throws IllegalStateException,
                   NoSuchElementException,
                   UnsupportedOperationException
Shows the next element in the iteration without proceeding the iteration (optional operation). After calling peek the returned element is still the shuffle-cursor's next one such that a call to next would be the only way to proceed the iteration.

Note, that this operation is optional and might not work for all cursors. After calling the peek method a call to next is strongly recommended.

Specified by:
peek in interface Cursor
Overrides:
peek in class SecureDecoratorCursor
Returns:
the next element in the iteration.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if the shuffle-cursor is already closed when this method is called.
NoSuchElementException - iteration has no more elements.
UnsupportedOperationException - if the peek operation is not supported by the shuffle-cursor.

The main method contains some examples to demonstrate the usage and the functionality of this class.

args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
